column2: [From.GetBestName], my Court Alchemist, has requested that I provide [From.GetHerHim] with some alchemical ingredients so that [From.GetSheHe] is better prepared should I see fit to request a potion from [From.GetHerHim].
I believe I can spare some...
I will pay for some ingredients...
Spare no expense!
[From.GetSheHeCap] should get [From.GetHerHim] own ingredients!

[From.GetBestName] has seen fit to provide me with some of [From.GetHerHis] own ingredients. I expect I will find them useful, both when it comes to my own experiments and when it comes to any potions [From.GetSheHe] might request of me.
My thanks!

[From.GetBestName] has seen fit to arrange for the purchase of some new alchemical ingredients. I expect I will find them useful, both when it comes to my own experiments and when it comes to any potions [From.GetSheHe] might request of me.
My thanks!

[From.GetBestName] has provided me with a large quantity of alchemical ingredients, no doubt purchased at great expense. There is no doubt that I will find them useful, whether in my own experiments or in any potions [From.GetSheHe] might see fit to request from me.
I truly appreciate it!

It seems [From.GetBestName] does not appreciate that my time is valuable and that alchemical ingredients are in short supply, seeing as [From.GetSheHe] has informed me that I should acquire my own igredients instead of requesting them from [From.GetHerHim].
I expected better than this!

[From.GetBestName], my Court Alchemist, has come to me with a request. It seems [From.GetSheHe] would like to offer [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetBestName] in exchange for [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetHerHim] drinking a potion that [From.GetBestName] wants to test. The outcome could potentially be fatal, but if it is not then [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetBestName] would go free.
For science!
I suppose I can agree to that...
Get your own test subjects!
I think not!
[From.GetBestName] has approved my request, no doubt approving of a little scientific experimentation. Now I just need to hope that [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetBestName] agrees to the proposal.
I will make the offer right away!
[From.GetBestName] has approved my request. Now I just need to hope that [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetBestName] agrees to the proposal.
I will make the offer right away!
[From.GetBestName] has refused to grant my request, stating that I should get my own test subjects rather than making use of [From.GetHerHis].
I expected better!
[From.GetBestName] has refused to grant my request, perhaps having moral qualms about experimenting on prisoners, even with their consent.
I see...

[prisoner_experimented_upon.GetBestName] has agreed to take part in [experimenting_alchemist.GetBestName]'s potion test, no doubt hoping that [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetSheHe] will go free without suffering any negative side effects. We shall soon see whether [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetSheHe] has chosen poorly...
For science!
Very well...
It seems [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetBestName] does not value [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetHerHis] freedom enough to risk consuming one of [experimenting_alchemist.GetBestName]'s potions.
But it is for science!
I see...

[prisoner_experimented_upon.GetBestName] has been released following [experimenting_alchemist.GetBestName]'s potion test. It seems [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetSheHe] is quite a bit healthier than before.
I hope [experimenting_alchemist.GetTitledFirstName] learned something...
I see...

It seems [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetBestName] is quite a bit healthier than before. What's more, [experimenting_alchemist.GetBestName] has altered [experimenting_alchemist.GetHerHis] deal with [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetHerHim], perhaps considering [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetHerHim] a too valuable test subject to release.
Logical, I suppose...
Well, I can't be blamed for that...

[prisoner_experimented_upon.GetBestName] has been released following [experimenting_alchemist.GetBestName]'s potion test. It seems [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetSheHe] is slightly healthier than before.
I hope [experimenting_alchemist.GetTitledFirstName] learned something...
I see...

It seems [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetBestName] is slightly healthier than before. The potion [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetBestName] consumed seems to have been rather less safe than [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetSheHe] probably predicted that it would be, seeing as [prisoner_experimented_upon.GetSheHe] has died. [experimenting_alchemist.GetBestName] has pronounced the experiment an unqualified success.
Thank you for your contributions!
Perhaps for the best...

Before approaching [brewing_potion.GetBestName] with my request for a healing potion I need to decide whether I should provide the ingredients, funds to purchase ingredients, or should rely on [brewing_potion.GetHerHis] generosity.
I will provide some of my ingredients!
I will pay for some new ingredients!
Surely [brewing_potion.GetSheHe] has ingredients to spare!
Actually, I will not be making a request...
[From.GetBestName] has requested that I brew a healing potion for [From.GetHerHim]. [From.GetSheHeCap] is offering to provide some of [From.GetHerHis] ingredients.
I will get started right away!
I have other potions to brew...
[From.GetBestName] has agreed to my request, and [From.GetSheHe] is already hard at work making the necessary preparations to brew the healing potion I requested.
As expected!
[From.GetBestName] did not agree to my request [From.GetSheHeCap] claims [From.GetSheHe] is brewing other potions and is unable to spare the time to brew one for me.
I see...
[From.GetBestName] has requested that I brew a healing potion for [From.GetHerHim]. [From.GetSheHeCap] is offering to provide enough funds to cover the cost of some ingredients.
I will get started right away!
I have other potions to brew...
[From.GetBestName] has agreed to my request, and [From.GetSheHe] is already hard at work making the necessary preparations to brew the healing potion I requested.
As expected!
[From.GetBestName] did not agree to my request [From.GetSheHeCap] claims [From.GetSheHe] is brewing other potions and is unable to spare the time to brew one for me.
I see...
[From.GetBestName] has requested that I brew a healing potion for [From.GetHerHim]. It seems [From.GetSheHe] expects me to provide the necessary ingredients.
I will get started right away!
Are you willing to consider it a Favor?
If we count it as a Favor repaid, sure!
You will need to pay me for the potion...
If you bestow some Grace, certainly!
I cannot spare the ingredients...
[From.GetBestName] did not agree to my request [From.GetSheHeCap] claims [From.GetSheHe] does not have the ingredients to spare.
I see...
[From.GetBestName] has agreed to my request, and [From.GetSheHe] is already hard at work making the necessary preparations to brew the healing potion I requested.
As expected!
[From.GetBestName] has informed me that [From.GetSheHe] would be willing to brew a healing potion for me if I am willing to owe [From.GetHerHim] a Favor in return.
Of course!
I think not!
[From.GetBestName] has agreed to owe me a Favor in exchange for me brewing a healing potion for [From.GetHerHim].
Excellent!
It seems [From.GetBestName] is not willing to owe me a Favor in exchange for me brewing a healing potion for [From.GetHerHim].
I see...
[From.GetBestName] has informed me that [From.GetSheHe] would be willing to brew a healing potion for me if I am willing to consider it the repayment of the Favor [From.GetSheHe] owes me.
Agreed!
I think not!
[From.GetBestName] has agreed to consider the healing potion a suitable repayment of the Favor I owed [From.GetHerHim].
Excellent!
It seems [From.GetBestName] would rather still be owed a Favor from me than [From.GetSheHe] would get a healing potion from me.
I see...
[From.GetBestName] has informed me that I will have to pay [From.GetHerHim] to brew a healing potion for me.
Your terms are acceptable!
I think not!
[From.GetBestName] has agreed to pay me for the healing potion [From.GetSheHe] requested from me.
Excellent!
It seems [From.GetBestName] is unwilling to pay me in exchange for the healing potion [From.GetSheHe] requested from me.
I see...
[From.GetBestName] has informed me that [From.GetSheHe] will brew the healing potion I requested if I bestow some Grace on [From.GetHerHim].
The Dragon Throne finds these terms agreeable!
Absolutely not!
[From.GetBestName] has agreed to bestow some Grace on me in exchange for the healing potion [From.GetSheHe] requested from me.
Excellent!
It seems [From.GetBestName] is unwilling to bestow some Grace on me in exchange for a healing potion.
I see...

Before I can get started on the potion I am brewing for [potion_target.GetBestName] I need to decide just what I am brewing. [potion_target.GetSheHeCap] would certainly expect to get what [potion_target.GetSheHe] asked for, but perhaps I have other plans...
I will help [potion_target.GetHerHim]!
I think a placebo would be best...
I want to hurt [potion_target.GetHerHim]!
I will brew something that seems more beneficial than it is...

I have some different ideas as to what I should put in the healing potion that I am brewing for [potion_target.GetBestName]. In particular, the primary ingredient or ingredients should be decided upon.
[GetSelectedIngredient_1] should work quite well...
Maybe I should go with some [GetSelectedIngredient_2]?
Both together might be best!
I have some different ideas as to what I should put in the placebo that I am brewing for [potion_target.GetBestName]. In particular, the primary ingredient or ingredients should be decided upon.
[GetSelectedIngredient_1] should work quite well...
Maybe I should go with some [GetSelectedIngredient_2]?
Both together might be best!

I have some different ideas as to what I should put in the potion - or, rather, poison - that I am brewing for [potion_target.GetBestName]. In particular, the primary ingredient or ingredients should be decided upon.
[GetSelectedIngredient_1] should work quite well...
Maybe I should go with some [GetSelectedIngredient_2]?
Both together might be best!

I have some different ideas as to what I should put in the potion - which I intend to have some delayed side-effects - that I am brewing for [potion_target.GetBestName]. In particular, the primary ingredient or ingredients should be decided upon.
[GetSelectedIngredient_1] should work quite well...
Maybe I should go with some [GetSelectedIngredient_2]?
Both together might be best!
[From.GetBestName] has presented me with the healing potion I requested, or at least that is what [From.GetSheHe] is telling me. Of course, [From.GetSheHe] might have brewed something else...
Thank you!
Actually, I don't want it!
It seems [From.GetBestName] has changed [From.GetHerHis] mind about the healing potion [From.GetSheHe] requested, as the potion I provided to [From.GetHerHim] has been returned to me.
I guess I will consume it instead...
I see...
